abstracts.cdata!:
Ratings convey a satisfactory project
            outcome, likely sustainability, and substantial
            institutional development impacts, including satisfactory
            performances by both the Bank and Borrower. Notwithstanding,
            lessons of experience outline, and are suggested as follows.
            It is reinforced that policy dialogue between the Borrower
            and the Bank requires flexibility, particularly when dealing
            with the evolving educational context. Specifically, the
            Bank responsiveness to the Borrower's needs was prompt,
            misunderstandings were timely reduced, all of which
            conducive to mutual confidence. In the context of sector
            reforms, the Government's political commitment was
            critical to the Project success: reforms were pursued in the
            basic education, and professional training sector with
            support being provided from across two ruling parties.
            However, the integration of the Project Unit (PCU) into the
            regular structure of the Ministry of Education (MOE)
            required capacity-building, and a good communication
            strategy, implemented through a gradual process. The prior
            assessment of the PCU capacity was crucial to ensure the
            success of school construction programs.
